description:
This course offers an individually designed program that enables students to gain hands-on experience in the practical application of communication principles and processes in a work environment. Students undertake short-term or part-time assignments with a host organisation of their choice. Tasks to be involved in can include creating a communication strategy or campaign, facilitating stakeholder engagement, creating relevant policy briefs, writing a research paper, developing project proposals, conducting a participatory situation analysis, capacity building, or reviewing existing communication practices. Suitability of proposed placements are discussed with each student individually. 

The Internship application form is available here.
prerequisites: Students must have completed at least two but preferably Part B courses in their specific field of study to be eligible to undertake COMU7015.
restricted: Direct enrolment is not possible; intending students must complete the application form and submit it to the School office. Permission to enrol will be granted once the application has been approved.
